tweets.hook: $MNDR spiked +215% but now just +54% ‚Äî and a fresh ATM filing makes it vulnerable. Here's how dilution could reshape this story. üßµ
breakdown: ATM = At-The-Market offering. Company can sell new shares anytime ‚Üí more supply ‚Üí weaker price. Like splitting a pizza into more slices ‚Äî same pie, smaller pieces. üçï

Why this caught my eye:
‚Ä¢ Market cap: $2.3M (tiny = vulnerable)
‚Ä¢ ATM filed: 2025-11-24 (3 days ago)
‚Ä¢ Price spiked +215% ‚Üí now +54%
High price + likely cash need = prime dilution setup

Additional context:
‚Ä¢ Volume fading ‚Äî early signs of distribution
‚Ä¢ Small float ‚Üí dilution hits harder per share
‚Ä¢ 161% off highs ‚Äî first cracks visible
Likely motive: company may need funding soon.

Bear thesis builds if:
‚Ä¢ Heavy red candle with elevated sell volume
‚Ä¢ Price fails to reclaim highs
‚Ä¢ ATM usage confirmed

Bull case: strong volume breakout ‚Üí ATM may pause.
Traders get trapped when dilution lands during pullbacks ‚Äî not the run.

This isn't advice ‚Äî just pattern recognition.

Big spike + small cap + fresh ATM = elevated risk profile.

Watch how it reacts to selling pressure ‚Äî that's where dilution becomes visible. ü¶Ö

chartAnnotations.volumeNote: Volume fades post-spike, indicating possible distribution.

rationale: A small company with a recent ATM filing and a volatile price suggests potential for new shares to dilute value, making it risky.
